resources.string: Anti-Apartheid Revolutionary and Former President of South Africa
Played a pivotal role in ending apartheid and fostering racial reconciliation in South Africa. Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.
Conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. First woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win in two different scientific fields: Physics (1903) and Chemistry (1911).
Discovered penicillin in 1928, leading to the development of antibiotics. Awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1945.
Led the American civil rights movement advocating for nonviolent resistance against racial segregation. Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964.
